alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 8:56PM MDT until July 30 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Fergus County in central Montana... East central Chouteau County in north central Montana... * Until 945 PM MDT. * At 855 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northeast of Geraldine, or 28 miles east of Fort Benton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Fergus and east central Chouteau Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall with this storm may lead to minor flash flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
